attributes.comment:
As a candidate for international adoption I find the proposed fee increases to
be almost punitive. America was founded on the premise that we are an open
nation, a place for many different peoples to come together and form something
that is greater than the sum of its individual parts. By increasing the rates
for international adoption, the government may be inadvertently closing one of
the doors to legal immigration. Adopting is already an expensive proposition and
while the increases may seem to be small and even reasonable, it may be removing
one family from considering adoption, domestic or international, due to the cost
of the endeavor.

Also, if one stops to consider a more macro scale. Adoption lessens the overall
tax burden of each citizen. By adopting a child, the dollars required to support
that child while they are a ward of the state would be lessened. By raising
fees, the government would be discouraging adoption rather than encouraging it.
Cost is always a factor in the lives of every American and this is just another
hit in the pocketbook
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Trevor Pope
